programmes.show_description: Quarry: Crime drama. Frost delves into the world of animal rights when a young protester is fatally injured in a confrontation with stewards at a meeting of the Denton Lacey Hunt.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Whose Baby?: Classic British sitcom. A nervous David prepares to break some bad news about the christening to Simon but ends up upsetting Oliver in the process as well.
Radio Control: Classic sitcom. Technology takes over at the depot as a new radio control system is introduced, but Stan and Jack cause chaos as they get to grips with the airwaves.
Mel and Greg Doland attempt to flee the village with Arthur to avoid the consequences of the impending DNA test results.
An elated Sean drives Jamie and Violet to their wits' end as they try to care for the baby, and Michelle lets Alex stay a while longer - with disastrous consequences.
Lauren spills the beans to Sean about Jamie and Violet's plans to move away, while Michelle tries to convince a panic-stricken Alex to unlock the pub door.
Dead Male One: When a corpse is dragged out of a river, a driving licence found on the body belongs to a person who has no connection with the dead man.
Taking Stock: The police discover that a man killed in a car accident had a chequered past, and Oscar and a reluctant Alf join forces on a private detective case that goes awry.
The Big Chill: Joe and Rachel try to uncover a drug-smuggling ring, Peggy spots a gap in the market with Bernie's hearse out of action, and Gina makes an unwelcome new friend.
Blue Herrings: Feature-length drama. DCI Barnaby and DS Troy are called upon by an aunt of Barnaby's to investigate the murder of an ex-schoolmistress in a nursing home.
Hilary decides to leave the village after Laurel tells her she doesn't want baby Arthur in her life. Gennie and her mother bump into a drunken Shadrach.
Gennie explains to Paddy why she snubbed Shadrach. Laurel is horrified to learn the villagers know about the baby swap, and Donna tells Viv there has been no news on Freddie.
A disillusioned Ryan decides he wants to move out and asks Liam if he can stay with him. Jamie gets a job in London and David's jealousy drives Tina away.
Violet takes advantage of the leap year and pops the question to Jamie, while David hopes to prove his love for Tina by getting her name tattooed on his arm.
Bully Boys: Younger questions his own abilities when he attends a local disturbance, and the police launch a dubious investigation into a former convict who is now a debt collector.
It Came from Outer Space: When an explosion starts rumours that a meteorite has crashed in Aidensfield, Miller and Rachel have other ideas and Joe goes undercover to find out more.
The Apple Doesn't Fall: Comedy-drama series. Martin is worried that Louisa might have anaemia, and a mother has problems with a daughter who is causing all sorts of trouble.
Movement: Comedy-drama series. When Martin encourages Bert to give up plumbing and open a restaurant, his opening night coincides with a sudden bout of suspected food poisoning.
Confection: With gossip and rumour threatening to expose the secrets of a sleepy Oxfordshire village, Endeavour investigates their connection to a series of shocking murders.
Dead Male One: When a corpse is dragged out of a river, a driving licence found on the body belongs to a person who has no connection with the dead man.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
The Scapegoat: Detective drama series. Wycliffe and his team investigate when the body of a local undertaker is thrown off a cliff in a bizarre annual ritual.
The Tangled Web: Detective drama series. When Wycliffe searches for a pregnant teenager who has gone missing from her village, he finds her feuding family are hiding some secrets.
The Quality of Mercy: When Lewis and Hathaway are called in to investigate the murder of a rising Oxford theatre star, they focus their suspicions on his acting colleagues.
The Mirror Crack'd From Side to Side: A fan dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail at a Hollywood star's party, but for whom was the fatal concoction really intended?
The Dream: When an industrialist consults Poirot about his suicidal dreams, Poirot finds that there is more to the dreams than anyone could imagine.
The Tree of Death: Light-hearted drama series. Rosemary and Laura find themselves caught up in a murder mystery while restoring a churchyard to its former glory for a medieval fair.
Bad Tidings: Murder mystery drama. Sergeant Dan Scott arrives to work with Barnaby - and is thrown straight into a murder investigation in Midsomer Mallow.
The Fisher King: Murder mystery drama. Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a 30-year-old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders.
Sins of Commission: Murder mystery drama. When Midsomer hosts its annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken and more writers die before a winner is announced.
The Maid in Splendour: Murder mystery drama. When Barnaby and Scott investigate the murder of a pub barman, Barnaby wonders if it may be the result of a case of mistaken identity.
Black Ice: Crime drama. DCI Vera Stanhope and her team face a series of daunting challenges.
